title: Rotation - Newtons second law and kinematics

content.question: Which of the following choices is most nearly the magnitude of the net torque exerted on the wheel as it slows?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.50 Newton Meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

<math alttext="1.0 Newton Meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

<math alttext="2.0 Newton Meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

<math alttext="3.0 Newton Meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>3.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1.0 Newton Meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">·</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
